Reviews.Title: major flaws, not really 720p, needs a firmware update
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera had a good price, but it is a disappointment.  Note that this is an older model; the latest models have an HDMI port and fewer bugs.* Not 720p / JPEG encoding artifacts: -1 StarThe CCD in this camera is natively 640x480.  If you choose the 720p recording mode, then  the camera just does pixel-doubling in software.This dashcam records to MJPEG files.  You won't be able to read license plates or recognize most faces because of compression artifacts.  The firmware lacks an option for changing JPEG quality.* Stops Recording When SD Card Is Full: -1 StarWhen the dashcam needs to rotate files on the SD card, it stops recording for up to two minutes, but an entire accident can happen in less than two minutes.  The actual amount of offline time seems to depend on the speed of the SD card.* Can't override poweroff:  -1 StarThis dashcam always powers off when external power disconnects, even if the internal battery if fully charged.  I want my dashcam to continue recording after an accident.* Can't run from a USB Port / Can't be used as a webcam:  -1 StarConnecting the USB port puts the camera into disk mode, which means that you must power it from the 5v connector.  You cannot power this dashcam from an in-vehicle USB port.  You cannot use this dashcam as a webcam.* Can't invert or rotate the video:  AnnoyanceThe firmware doesn't have an option for changing the recording orientation.* Can't change the recording overlays: AnnoyanceThe only overlay option is a timestamp.* Nearly ideal form factor: +1 StarThe size and shape of this dashcam is nearly perfect, and it uses a standard threaded mount, like on a regular camera tripod.  It is much smaller than the stock photography makes it seem.  The built-in folding LCD is probably the best feature.* Adequate performance in a variety of lighting conditions: +1Sun flaring is minor.  Quality is okay at night with street lights and head lights.* Additional NotesThis camera records to MJPEG AVI with 8 kHz PCM mono audio.  Audio quality is poor; you can't hear conversations over white noise while driving, and it is unlikely that you would get all of a conversation while stopped with a traffic cop.Wake-up on motion detection is pretty good.In standard quality, this camera uses 2GB per hour.Power draw is less than 5 watts at 5 volts, so you can run this camera off of a car battery for a long time.This camera seems to be running an embedded BSD.  A firmware update could get me to add one or two stars to this review.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera to protect yourself
Reviews.Author: Cautious Shopper
Reviews.Content: I use this camera to protect myself from the lousy/agressive drivers in our area that seem to be growing by leaps and bounds.  I have been using the camera for about a month now with an 8 GB card.  Using the default video settings (mid range for capture) the 8 GB card stores about 3 hours of good quality video.  The 120 degree field of view can capture the traffic lights even if you are at the stop line.  Very Strong Sun Glare did not harm the camera although the objects were all darkened since they were all backlit.  Night time capture is adequate based off of the headlights but don't expect daytime capture.  (The IR cameras are described as not being able to go through the glass windshield so not much of an option.) The auto start/stop and auto rollover works as advertised.  The products instructions are really poor.  (I suspect that the unit is made in Russia since the only other instructions are in Russian, but so is the Mig-29!)  If you want to change the defaults (e.g. I wanted a 15 min. capture window and setting the date.) You need to fumble with the buttons on the left first pressing MENU twice and then rec/snap to get the camera into the change mode and then use the buttons on the right to get the values to change.  If you miss the right year you need to go past 2034 and then it rolls back to the start year.  They need a definite rewrite.

The video was edited with Nero and lost some Quality, also if I cleaned my windschield before the view was much better, at the video you will see a vehicle turned to the right on red, and almost was hit by another driver. Just be prepared and protect yourself :-)

Reviews.Title: Pretty good value
Reviews.Author: Robbert Patrison
Reviews.Content: I bought this Car DVR recorder with fairly low expectations, both given the very low price and the very mixed reviews at Amazon. After a thorough test and break-in, I am positively surprised. I would recommend this as a low cost way to record evidence for unexpected cases where it is useful to replay the past accurately.The DVR is produced by an unidentified Chinese company. It is surprisingly good for something that's made and designed in China. There is a flip-down LCD screen of decent quality that can be used for setup and instant playback. Opening up the small unit revealed a clean printed circuit board with just 2 chips: a Korean memory chip and a CPU chip of unknown origin. Control is through 6 buttons on either sides. Its not as convenient as a touch screen, but it does the job. The included suction mount was bulkier and less flexible than the one on the picture. This design does not allow mounting the using behind the rear-view mirror, so I need to look for some more compact suction mount.The unit runs on it built-in battery power for at least an hour. This allows the camera to be used in the same was a a flip camera. Its small and light enough for use as a spy cam or on board of a model airplane. Plugged into the cigarette lighter adapter, the DV starts recording automatically when the car starts, and stops about 30 seconds after the ignition is cut. This is the desired behavior for a 'black box'.The included manual is terrible, as expected. Special highlight is the final section "Small tip to save you big headache" which describes the many blessings of the reset button. The manual is not adapted for the different versions on the product, describing features that do not exist (such as HDMI output, frame rate selection, audio on/off) and omitting some useful options that are supported. Using some trial and error, however, its not too hard to find your way.Video quality is indeed nowhere near HD standard. I could not see any difference in resolution between the 'XVGA' and 'VGA', so its best to stick with basic VGA which results in a 30% smaller files and a higher frame refresh rate. The camera sensor is likely the culprit. The lens is wide angle, producing a decent panoramic view with the usual distortion around the corners. Color reproduction is weak. Given the 'black box' application we don't care too much about that. Low light performance is passable. Though not HD, the quality is still better than the standard resolution camcorders of only a few years ago. Sound quality is poor, with lots of hissing, but conversations in the car are easy to understand.The DVR performs decent image stabilization, which causes the movies to be quite smooth, even on bumpy roads. That is a very useful undocumented feature. Other undocumented features include digital zoom and a few image viewing options. The picture includes a date and time stamp for record keeping. The built-in clock turns out to be stable and accurate.The DVR records .avi movies in segments of up to 15 minutes. There is only a short 1 second gap between the segments. The gap was a major complaint in most other reviews, but its pretty good on my unit. Apparently the new firmware improved this. Each 15-minute .avi file is about 720Mb which should yield about 11 hours of total recording on a 32G SD card before old files are overwritten. The LCD display shows the estimated remaining recording time, though the value is on the optimistic side.Playback on the built-in LCD screen is decent. This feature could save your day, for instance instantly proving to a cop that you are not on the cell phone while driving. There is no fast forward, unfortunately, which makes it a pain to find the proper scene. Plugging in the unit in a computer mounts the SD card as a hard drive. The USB data transfer rate cannot keep up with the video bit rate in my experience. I am not sure whether this is caused by the SD card I am using or whether its due to the USB interface. Its not a big problem, as files can be copied to the PC for smooth playback. Playback on using video signal on a TV possible, but its just not very useful.Overal, this DVR does the job for very little money. Compared to the other options (such as Itronics), it does nearly the same job and sports a built-in screen at a fraction of the price. It lacks HD and GPS, but neither of those are really essential for a car 'black box'.Update May 2013 (1.5 year later): The dashcam is still working flawlessly, faithfully recording whenever my car drives.  Same product now costs even less.

Reviews.Title: For people having fuzzy image : read this !
Reviews.Author: olivier
Reviews.Content: I bought the same kind of device and the image was focusing only around 50cm meaning somebody or something beyond 50cm was completely fuzzy so the cam was useless...Actually the focus is simply set by adjusting the lens like you can do with binaculars. I guess the chinese worker who did it need glasses :)So I dismounted the device (only 6 screws) and turn the lens until I see things around 50 meters perfectly clean.I hope it will help people having this problem...Cheers

Reviews.Title: Not all that you'd expect
Reviews.Author: Deal Finder
Reviews.Content: I have been using this for a few days now. First, it took them till the end of the 3rd day to ship it which caused total delivery time to be around 9-10 days. I received it and it is one of those Chinese drop ship items. It has a surprising range of features for the price, such as auto on/off and auto record triggered by power from the cigarette lighter adapter. When the sd card is full it will loop the record and overwrite the oldest files first. The built in battery allows it to properly close out the files when the power from the adapter is cut so, in an accident, losing power will not cause you to lose the current file; which may be the most important one. The unit I received did not have a hdmi port like the photo but the opening is still cut into the casing; found this after the inspection sticker fell off after the 2nd day of use. Playback is not possible on this device. I have used 2 sdhc cards which says on the box are supported; one Kingston class 6 4gb card and one transcend class 10 16gb card. Trying to initiate playback with either card results in "one moment" appearing on the screen followed by the word "one" disappearing leaving half of the "o" yet, nothing else happens(waited up to 5min). Occasionally it will indicate "fwd 1x" but still not play, pressing the up button sometimes causes it to display "bwd 1x" but nothing plays. In the whole playback attempt process it will randomly give 2-3mm wide vertical lines of distorted picture over the still image of the first video frame. Another thing to note is the video format of the files it creates are AVI. A 4gb card will give 2:20 hr:min of record in VGA format and 1:22 hr:min in D1 and SXGA. 16gb card increased the VGA to over 9 hours. When transferring the video files to your computer you better use a sd card adapter because the maximum transfer speed that this thing can handle is apparently 1 mb/s. The video seems clear enough to see what is going on in a wide angle area in front of you but is not sharp enough to read the license plate off of the car in front of you sitting at a traffic light. I have not used when fully dark but twilight recordings are good in detail except oncoming headlights cause moments where the camera is basically blinded. The video displays on the lcd so it is right side up when the unit is mounted with the lcd folding down when opened, with no option that allows you to change this if you choose to mount it in any other orientation; like mounting it to your dash with the lcd folding up when opened. Conclusion, it's much better than nothing at all in providing piece of mind, but you get what you pay for in the quality of the video and craftsmanship.

Reviews.Title: Be careful of this one....you get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Syndar4
Reviews.Content: I received this as a Christmas gift. Bought the SD card which costs as much as the unit. Installed it in Jan new year and checked it out after a day running. Videos opened and looked good on PC. Installed it the unit for fulltime service. Light came on, made its chirps when I turned the car off. All seemed well. After two weeks, I was curious as to what all got recorded. Found out the thing quit recording over a week ago. Also found out the unit wouldnt start at all to get into the menu etc..what a waste of time and money. I filed a claim. NST gifts said I could bye a replacement for $15 !!! I emailed them back and said Amazon didnt list that as an option. Return to vendor was what Amazon instructed NST gifts. So the y finally gave me an RA to send back, at my cost, and if it was defective, they would send me another ! hah NO THANKS... never again

Reviews.Title: not work at accident
Reviews.Author: Deisai
Reviews.Content: UPDATE at Oct-13:The camera stops right at the moment accident(side collision) happened,  the last minute missed and not been saved at all.It still 'works' after the entire year, it is 'ok' as a camera ------- but can not be tolerate as dashboard DVR.-------------------------------------------------------------bad:1.It works ok at day but the image is blurry at night.2.Resolution is ok at day time, not make sense at night.3.Sound recording works, but the quality is similar to old style radio channel.4.My on/off button doesn't work at all, even after fully charged.5.The default language is ...Russian , I guess. So it will probably takes you about 15 min to change back to english.good:1.Sucker works perfect. (Now it is winter, ,dont know how it works at summer yet)2.Power cord is lonnnnnnnnnng enough.3.USB connection works fine, you can transfer data through it if you dont have card reader.4.Cheap.5.Cheap.6.Cheap.Overall: it worth what it cost.

Reviews.Title: Works well only in daylight
Reviews.Author: Abhi
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly good product for the price, and also feature-wise when compared to its competitors.Here are some of the essential parameters that strongly suggest why you should buy this product:1) Ease of use - very few products are available today that work as seamlessly as this one. It has long wires, that simply plug in into your car charger (works through an extension as well, if you wanna plug other devices too), and then forget about it. It will automatically switch on everytime your car is turned on, and hence is a good safety device to be used in an accident.2) Accepts upto 32GB - this is good, as it is able to record upto 12 hours of continuous driving.3) Automatically creates .avi files - just click them to watch the videos, no conversion required.4) Records good audio - it can record all the songs i am playing in the car and GPS voices, etc.5) Suction cup mechanism - it is a very strong attachment, and does keep the camera very stable on the windshield.Some of the cons are:1) Can't read license plates - it's not that much of a big deal, as i am not interested, as its the driver's actions that matters and that too only if its a serious accident.2) Works poorly at night, hence can't see more than two cars ahead of you.3) Only two degrees of rotation, hence can be difficult to attach to the windshield during first installation.

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moRTE9D9BQFYAEcurrentClick) { return cv_moRTE9D9BQFYAEcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:21 MinsI recently purchased this to record any event or incident that takes place during my daily commutes. First off, overall rating Thumbs up with few minor issues. HD? dont even try it.. the VGA standard is just as good I believe.This unit was easy to mount, long enough power adapter to run along the seems of the door to the of the rearview mirror. The unit records video just like you would see on regular broadcast non-hd television which is fine for just evidence of how the crash or incident happened. License plates..only up real close. The features are just really small not even worth mentioning. It was meant to record and view..Now I suggest like some others recording at 5 minutes instead of 10 or 1 minute. It will catch what happens better before jumping 2 to 3 seconds between files. It will have a better chance of saving your file instead of the 10 minute video which might lose battery charge.I'm going to test the battery to see how long it last here in the future and I will revise the review. The auto start and record function works fine with most vehicles that have a Power Accessory Outlet that cuts off after you turn the car off...If yours doesnt and stays on like my H3.. You have to actually physically hit record to stop and power off. When I get in the car I have to actually hit the power ON because my outlet is 24/7 live. NOTE: if this is something important to you..check your outlet first.Overall: Not the police hard drive dashcams like watchguard..but it will do for the commute or traveling for most.One other thing..forget the audio..it doesnt pick up well.

Reviews.Title: not HD, not even close...
Reviews.Author: LastKarankawa "LastKarankawa"
Reviews.Content: And the picture is one of the worse I've seen, and I see a lot because I buy these often for a device I make and sell to the film industry. For this cam to be advertised as HD is an outright lie. The best this can do is a software stretch out SXGA to 1281x560 which is not HD and the picture will prove that.HD starts at 1280x720Also beware on the return side of these China toys. I have a dead cam sitting on a shelf because I refuse to spend $52 to return it. Not the USA sellers fault, it's just the way it is since we no longer actually make things here anymore.

Reviews.Title: good chinese junk
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I bought this product, and didn't recieve the right one. The Amazon guy said that there's no such a product. It didn't had the HDMI, very poor quality, complete chinese junk!!! for this product one star is too much!  I'm very dissapointed with this junk. Sorry but this is true.Motion Detect Car Dash Video Camera Recorder DVR

Reviews.Title: Very poor image quality, this is NOT HD.
Reviews.Author: Dmitri Toptygin
Reviews.Content: I received this "720P HD motion detect car dash video camera recorder 2.5 inch TFT LCD 1280x720, 30fps" as a birthday present about three weeks ago. By now I have tested all its operating modes, and I am completely dissatisfied. I do not recommend this DVR, because it cannot really provide useful evidence in the case of an accident.The resolution is totally unacceptable. Theoretically 720P should look crisp on a wide screen TV, but the video from this DVR looks terribly fuzzy on every screen. A 720P DVR should be able to reproduce 360 white and 360 black horizontal lines (a total of 720 horizontal lines) or 640 white and 640 black vertical lines (a total of 1280 vertical lines). For the resolution test I have long sheets of paper with hundreds of white and black stripes of equal width. I spent an hour taking pictures of these stripes from different distances, both in horizontal and in vertical orientation. Here are the results: 70 white and 70 black horizontal lines (140 total), 120 white and 120 black vertical lines (240 total). This is about one fifth of the resolution that is normally considered "High Definition". Why is the resolution so bad? First, the optics (the lens) is very cheap. In fact, this is the worst of all lenses I saw on webcams and digital photo cameras. Second, the sensor does not have enough pixels for true HD quality.Color reproduction is completely unacceptable. If there is a traffic light in the field of view, it is always white. The red light is white, the green is white, and the yellow is also white. The only way to tell which light is on is by its position (top means red, bottom means green). However, because of the poor resolution you cannot see whether the top or the bottom is on unless the distance to the traffic light is less than 30 feet. When you are further than 120 feet from the traffic light, you cannot see whether there is a traffic light at all (it completely vanishes against the blue sky). At distances between 30 and 120 feet you can see a bright white spot (brighter than the background), and closer than 30 feet you see a dark rectangle with a white spot at the top (means read), at the bottom (green), or in the middle (yellow). Grass is usually more or less green, and you can also see colors of other large objects if they are not too bright. Unfortunately, the colors on a traffic light are so bright that the sensor becomes saturated and then every color becomes white.It is absolutely impossible to read the license plate of a car right in front of you when you drive at a close distance or when you are parked on a parking lot and the distance between the cars is just one foot. If you move any closer, then the hood of your own car will block the license plate you are trying to read, but on the video from this DVR you still cannot read the number. When you drive on a highway, you cannot tell whether the car in front of you has a license plate at all. Likewise, road signs are all just rectangles, you cannot read what's on them.Sound quality: try to speak loud and then listen to the record. You should be able to recognize that this is a human voice, but it is not possible to understand the words.The DVR has a HDMI connector. I bought a mini-HDMI to HDMI cable and tried to connect this DVR to different TV sets. It turns out that there is no HDMI output signal. You can view the video only using the USB port (for this you need a computer, not just a TV set).I tried HD resolution and VHS resolution, in combination with 10, 20, and 30 frames per second, both with and without sound. I hoped that maybe one of these combinations will provide acceptable image quality, but this did not happen.Conclusion: HD is a joke. The gadget is useless.

Reviews.Title: Motion Detect Car Dash Video Camera Recorder DVR
Reviews.Author: Byron
Reviews.Content: This is the worst product I have ever bought in Amazon. The item is cheap and if for some reason this product is defected , you would have a hard time getting your money back for your return shipping. The seller  is not willing to assume responsibility of paying defected shipping returns.  I definitely do not recommend buying this product at all.

Reviews.Title: Does its job well
Reviews.Author: Yary88
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased another car and decided that a car dash cam could come in handy.  Researched many cameras even some well over $250.  Decided that this camera would work for the basic essentials.  Others camera could record when car was parked over night since it had motion control and other features.  Felt that these features were not necessary for a extra $200.This camera does not come with instructions but its practically self explanatory.  Purchased a 16gb sd card which records over 5 hrs with this camera.  Camera isn't the greatest since you cannot really see license plates of the car in front - only if you are practically on theyre bumper.  Camera would work to prove fault in a accident in which case you can just get the license plate when filing a report.  Will not be helpful in getting plate if it is a hit and run.Camera cannot be beat for the price tag!

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed in Quality
Reviews.Author: James J
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about a month and the suction cup rubber just broke off from the camera mount stand.  The camera itself continuously made beeping sounds.So I am fairly dissapointed in the quality.

Reviews.Title: Does not record while saving the video segment
Reviews.Author: Ward "WardnTX"
Reviews.Content: The camera is ok for use but has a flaw. It records in avi format and saves in 2, 5 or 15 minute increments. While it is saving that file, it is not recording so there is a 6- 10 second loss in time which could very well be critical video you needed. So if a critical event occurs while the camera is saving the previous time segment, you have no video.I use the  video copilot VC-100 which uses a ccd lens instead of cmos and has a better night quality picture and best of all, it does not record in segments. It starts recording as soon as it gets power from the ignition and continues till it is turned off in one video.You can choose the time you need to backup and save for evidence and there is no risk of previous time not being there. It is the best camera by far that I have tried and recommend anyone serious about recording with a dash cam check into it. It is the preferred choice by professional truckers.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - great price
Reviews.Author: Polacek

I set the camera to record 15 minute intervals. When the card is full, it takes about 8 seconds to delete the oldest file and start a new one. When the camera is set to record 5 minute intervals, it takes about 3 seconds for the same process. This is good to know because the "near accident" happened at about the 14:45 mark. Another 15 seconds and I would have missed the entire situation. I try to delete the files every other day so that I get continous recording (takes about 1 second between recordings). Nice setup. 4:3 or wide screen settings available.Video is low quality because I changed the format to upload, otherwise the image is nice.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: RT
Reviews.Content: I thought this should be a great product, and had hopes that it would work, while accepting that it likely would not do everything claimed for so little money.  I charged the battery as I should have, then attempted to set it up and operate.  Item will turn on eventually, but is totally messed up.  The camera insists on showing everything upside down, regardless of orientation of camera.  The set-up items do not work, and do not follow the horrible written instructions that came with the unit.  The languages scroll (you can't stop or choose one) and the menu has English smattered with Russian and I don't know what.  Hitting the reset button gives the same results.  I have never been so disappointed in an electronic device purchase, and am disappointed in myself for ordering it.  Save your money.

Reviews.Title: Not same product as ordered
Reviews.Author: Edward Hardy
Reviews.Content: The product I received does not have HDMI output slot for playback on TV as stated on Amazon website. I expect to get what I pay for, also I expect to get what I order. I am returning unused, I do not know if it works or not.

Reviews.Title: Works as described
Reviews.Author: M. Mcguigan
Reviews.Content: no complaints. Unit is much smaller than I would have imagined. Which is good.  Directions are a comical translation, "The unit will blickering upon start up" but truthfully you won't need them. If the picture looks out of focus, you probably missed the little strip of protective plastic accross the camera lens. Obviously I did.

Reviews.Title: only one problem
Reviews.Author: gBo
Reviews.Content: The suction cup works great better than Garmin provided with theirs. Over heating from the 100 degree weather we had while sitting in car while parked. This product has a safety feature that kicks the memory out if it gets to hot. Very nice feature. Has great quality picture with a EASY setup program.

Reviews.Title: It has potential but unreliable chinese prodcut.
Reviews.Author: reviewer 8
Reviews.Content: The adapter became no good in 2 weeks, kept blowing the fuse everytime. Had to pay $20 to replace it. Requested a replacement from seller, never got one, not even a reply. The box shows a device with HDMI capabilities, it didn't have it on the actual camera I got. It is not HD at all. The adapter must be connected at all times or it won't power up, it doesnt charge. It functions and a positive is that it doesn't have any skip between files. I haven't tried many of the features, it did come with an English manual. The zoom lense works, but really hardly needed or useful.Taking into consideration the possibility of getting into an accident and the hassle of going thru that by what "he said, she said "etc.. I decided to keep it. Since the market is still new and the prices are still very high for more reliable dash cams. I guess this cam would be considered a gamble. Also note that the DS Card is not included so that would be another $20-40 dollars more depending on the size you get. The smaller size should work fine 16 gb.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money!!
Reviews.Author: Chelillo
Reviews.Content: Sometimes records and sometimes not, there was an accident in front of me, later when i got home I wanted to see it no where to be found!

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY IT
Reviews.Author: Lawrence A Van Sce
Reviews.Content: This product does not work.  From the time I removed it from the box I have had to reset it several times. It will never show any other date time stamp than the year 2000. Sometimes product does not work at all. You cannot call a tech support line. Half the instructions are written in Japanese. This camera was the second one sent to me. The first one I sent back it didn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: Handy device, but not quite 5 star
Reviews.Author: Josiah A. Teal "The Scientist"
Reviews.Content: Quick review:Cons: 120 degree range makes it look like cars right in front of you are far away. Cannot see far ahead.  Controls for reviewing videos and changing settings are awkward.  3 second intervals between file creation often happen at critical moments.Pros: Small device, so it doesn't take up a lot of space or get in the way.  Device continuously records, recycling card space automatically (if you catch something you want to save, upload it to your computer or replace SD card to avoid overwriting).  Automatic start up is convenient.  Having video evidence on your side in time of need is a massive relief if the time ever comes.Overall, I was impressed with the price and the device so far works quite well. I have not yet attempted to upload footage to my computer, so I have nothing to say about the process involved.

Reviews.Title: An excellent addition to any vehicle.
Reviews.Author: Supraman
Reviews.Content: Plug n play. Excellent picture quality. Small enough to not get in the way. Fits right under the Garmin Nuvi. Not only can you capture the scenery of your drive or any sudden occurences nearby but also should another vehicle cut you off or you get into a fender bender or worse then there is video proof of the incident. I'd score this a 9/10.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this model, not from Amazon or ebay, anywhere.
Reviews.Author: N. Kim
Reviews.Content: This particular model is made in china as one of the cheapest car DVR. This model is designed so poorly, with number of bugs. This unit freezes randomly under normal circumstances, makes broken AVI files most of the time, motion detection function is 'functional' less than half the time at best (you need to plug it out to reset it, power button doesn't even respond once it freezes), and so on and on... The only thing working with this unit is the car mount, with good suction cap, and long enough power adapter. The picture quality is so bad,, cannot even read the license plate# right in front of you. This unit doesn't have real-time brightness/contrast adjustability, so if you started your car in a garage (relatively darker) then come out to street, the image will become completely washed-out (total blackened-out if the other way around). This unit is not worth the money, maybe ok for $10 with free shipping as a 'toy'. I gave it 1 star, cuz i cannot give 0 star, which I intended to.

Reviews.Title: Don't waist your time.
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: I red planty of mediocre reviews for this product but for $50 figured I'll try it anyway. I was hoping for mediocre product but got product that didn't work at all. The only button that worked was the power button. Product wouldn't record, image on the monitor was barely visible and none of the buttons were working. Memory card wouldn't even stay inside the camera, kept poping out. The only thing that worked was the suction cup. Don't even bother, get something else.

Reviews.Title: Very poor - look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: Terry M
Reviews.Content: This powered up and seemed to be recording but the quality is so poor that it was useless for what it was intended - wasn't worth returning.

Reviews.Title: More crap from China.
Reviews.Author: JennyClyde
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these a while back and never reviewed them.  Upon opening, they were made poorly cheap, loose plastic.  Only one was usable, as the other was in Chinese, and we could not figure out how to change the language.  The one we were able to use worked pretty well for the first 4 months or so before it just randomly started turning off on its own.  Then, it stopped accepting the SD card that had been in it all along - insertion would turn the camera off (the SD card works in all other devices, so it was not the card).  Pretty pointless to have a camera that doesn't record...  So, we decided to give the other camera a shot, since I never did get around to returning it.  It was a miracle!!  It was, somehow, in English!!?  We plugged that sucker in, and it worked like a charm for a whole week before it too started turning off intermittently.  Now, you have to turn it on constantly.  In fact, I'm reviewing this while I shop for a better product to replace this garbage.

Reviews.Title: Toy yes, camera forget it.
Reviews.Author: Harold Zechner
Reviews.Content: There was no real way of attaching the camera to it's mount. Don't know if that was improper parts or poor design.  Don't care I just want to be able to mount it.  Camera did work but video quality was terrible.  As I mentioned to Amazon, "There are some things that are made so cheaply Amazon would be better off not even handling them.  No sorry I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: james c chivers
Reviews.Content: The recording software in the unit is not compatible with windows 7 and it corrupted my desktops card reader programs and I had to reload them to get my card reader to work again.  The operational instructions with the unit are vague at best and in some places, make no sense at all. The unit itself is a fine piece of electronic engineering if you have the time to figure out how to set it up and operate it. Of course, if you can read Russian, its probably allot easier

Reviews.Title: can understand
Reviews.Author: ted
Reviews.Content: my problem with this is all the operating instructions are written in chinese,its worthless to try to use don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: Solid and working great after 1 month...
Reviews.Author: R. Smith
Reviews.Content: Takes great video/ audio, and nicely installed right below/ right of windshield camera.  Popping out the memory card works great to review the video in you PC.  Feel protected at least with some continuous video being taken.

Reviews.Title: safety device might save our butt
Reviews.Author: Christopher Quintana
Reviews.Content: nightime vision is very poor as others have reported, but it can still record the event and save your butt.  Daytime recording is great.  I would recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, not bad...
Reviews.Author: Pedro Rios
Reviews.Content: This camera is not bad for having a backup in case you need to proof you were innocent on an accident.Don't expect tje best audio quality, is not as good, also, motion detector i found it not very good.I am using this camera on my work as Security Camera to record my employees, but it's useless since the motion detector don't detect people's movement or objects.On nights, is not good, you barely can see things, so if you drive too much on night, you might better consider a real HD camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Brad Hogg
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how great this camera works for the price!  I actually bought two so I can have one forward and one rearward facing.  They work exactly as described.  The video is surprisingly smooth and clear for the price of the camera.  I highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for an economical dash cam.

Reviews.Title: Good device for the price
Reviews.Author: V. Komarov
Reviews.Content: Good camera with more than acceptable video quality.I had some concerns with other reports about video recording gaps due to saving files issue. Did not see this problem. Perhaps other people have used old and slow memory card.The gap between files with my Level 4 SD card was less than a second for video files with 5 mins duration.Pros:1. Cheap2. Easy to install2. Good video qualityCons:1. Sensor's dynamic range is not very good.2. No night vision3. Audio level is kind of low (do not need it much)

Reviews.Title: Cheap price for piece of mind
Reviews.Author: M. Finn
Reviews.Content: Like the camera, love the price. Within a week of owning it I got a great video of an SUV rolling. Besides providing a great unimpeeachable witness in case of an accident, this camera would be awesome for putting in your child's car to monitor their driving...

Reviews.Title: It works, but definitely not as described...
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these. Like all products, you get with you pay for. This item does have it's pros and cons. I do feel the description is deceptive...there is no HDMI port. The video is not HD either. However, I didn't need the HD video nor the HDMI port. The camera takes both still photos and video. The camera functions as I need it to... It automatically powers on upon starting my car (from power to the cigarette lighter) and records only when motion is detected, and then powers off when I turn my car off. My only issue is the time/date stamp resets itself at times to year 2045, which is odd because the second one I purchased resets itself to 2010 (different firmware?). It's nice because it's about the size of an iPhone and does everything I need it to on its own. If you don't need the small 2.5" screen, you can probably get away with buying Mini Car Dashboard Camera Dash Cam Accident Recorder. Suppport up 32 TF Card ,120° View Angle Record Both Vedio and Audio, Clear Image

Reviews.Title: Must Have for Every Driver
Reviews.Author: Gregory Giovanni
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 6 months ago. Take my advice and purchase a 32GB SDHC Card straight away. The 32GB holds 7 days of moderate driving.

Reviews.Title: not really HD720p
Reviews.Author: Elena
Reviews.Content: Got it from DBROTH - seems like a chip fake! This in not the HD720p. This is a clone with much worse screen resolution (looks like 640*480 + interpolation + worse sensitivity) and sound quality is a disaster. Don't buy this item.

Reviews.Title: Very good product best pricing on the web
Reviews.Author: van72
Reviews.Content: I bought several of these car cam. That the best on I ve bought so far.You will find the same product for double price on most eBay and online shops.5star no doubt

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: K. Purdy
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, and the fact that it was being sent directly from China - I was expecting to be disappointed. I wasn't! It's a great dashcam for the price. It records in a few modes, none really HD quality, but that's okay if you're just looking for a visual record of driving events. I was also impressed by the record levels at lower light. All in all, a decent little, simple dashcam.

Reviews.Title: It bricks - fatal firmware flaws
Reviews.Author: A. Mandadi
Reviews.Content: If you search Amazon for dash cam products, you'll find a different depiction of what appears to be this same product from another distributor.  This is a modified re-post of my review for that other product.***This device from its appearance in the photograph is a clone of a device I regrettably purchased from Dealextreme (it shipped out of Hong Kong and now I can't find a way to return it). Design-wise the description is not accurate as several of the other reviewers noted: it is not HD. In fact, if you try to switch it to the higher resolution mode, it will crash the device. I used mine in low-res for 6 weeks, after which it started bricking. After a few days of constantly pushing the reset button because of the bricking, it seized for good, and now won't power on at all.Those are the bad points - the device fails outright in just a few weeks. However, this device also has some GOOD points and if they could just fix the obvious firmware problems, it would probably be a really good purchase for the money. What's neat about it is that it comes on automatically when the car starts, and records convenient video segments. When you turn your car off, it writes the final segment to its SD card and shuts itself off automatically - you don't have to mess with it. Video segments are easy to retrieve from the SD card. In these respects, it's very well designed as a plug-and-play-and-forget-about-it device for users of lower technical skill.Except for the fatal firmware flaws, that is. Watch additional reviews of dash cams on Amazon to see if / when the firmware issues are resolved. And for goodness sake, don't buy one of these unless you're sure the problems have been addressed.

Reviews.Title: It worked once.
Reviews.Author: Jeff C
Reviews.Content: I received this item, turned it on, and was happy to see the color LCD screen, showing the incoming image from the camera.  I then took it out to the car, mounted it on the window, and plugged it into the cigarette lighter.  Nothing happened.  The red light came on for the cigarette lighter plug, but nothing happened with the unit.  I thought perhaps I needed to insert a memory card, or that perhaps something might be wrong with the mini-USB connector, so I took it back inside, plugged in a memory card (yes, it was right side up) and then used the regular USB connector that also came with the unit, and plugged it into my computer.  Again, nothing.  I have since taken out the memory card and tried it, and have used a different memory card and tried it, with no result.  The on/off, menu, and rec/snap buttons on the side of the unit do nothing, and the down, up, and mode buttons on the other side of the unit also do nothing.  So, I guess I'll be figuring out how to return this unit.

Reviews.Title: Cheap camera, not worth what I paid.
Reviews.Author: Gordon Mitchell "Brogan"
Reviews.Content: This camera is made of very cheap materials.  Feels like it is going to fall apart when you pick it up.  The video quality is not bad, when you can get it to work.  After only a few months of using it in my car the camera would constantly freeze, I kept having to push the reset button.  I would not recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: car dash digital video camera
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: easy to install and operate. very clear video quality. can record clearly while driving at night provided that there are street lights; even where there are no street lights the video quality is acceptable.the high capacity memory card is convienient for long drives like 14 or 16 hours. has great other features.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: Kristian Forestier
Reviews.Content: The camera works just fine. The video quality is not the best but I'm not complaining for what I paid for it. It turns on when i start the car and turns off when I turn the car off. I have a 32gb card which probably records over 15 hours of video and audio. The audio is not the best but conversations can be understood. I am pretty happy with the camera but i have only had it for a week so we will see how long it lasts.

Reviews.Title: nice not bad
Reviews.Author: jose cortez
Reviews.Content: i like the motion detect setting, it record clear not bad for the price. im happy with this product.it also have zoom in and out just great. the audio needs some work on, but over all great. the built in battery last for about 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: SEEMED OK, WORKED
Reviews.Author: L. E. WAGNER "ERIK"
Reviews.Content: WHAT MORE CAN I SAY? IT IS WHAT IT IS AND WHEN YOU NEED SOME THING YOU TRY FOR THE BEST PRICE BUT ALSO GOOD QUALITY

Reviews.Title: Work good
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: I will give 5 stars, if it will show my speed too. Its good camera, but did not show the speed.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Ken Anderson
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is typically grainy, or jerky.  It claims to be able to use up to a 64G card, but it won't recognize that size card.  However, for the price, it's a pretty darn good camera.

Reviews.Title: I guess it's ok
Reviews.Author: SHERRY WATKINS
Reviews.Content: I received my product and set it up, the car charger did not work so I had to find one to replace this one, I don't know why it does not work, I tried it in different ports and still it did not work. Other than that everything is working fine.

Reviews.Title: It was pretty good
Reviews.Author: josephcodner
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good camera, thought it had stopped working but it was my memory card. I would buy this can again

Reviews.Title: No Motion Detector as Publicized
Reviews.Author: Maxime Manuel "M Square"
Reviews.Content: They said that there is motion detector on it. That's not true. Mine have no option like this. This spy cam does not have a 720p definition. You cannot read car plates unless they are at least 20 meter (around 60 foot). The sound is not that great.But somehow I use my spy cam in my car everyday. I am somehow happy with it for this price. But they lied about the motion detector this is why I am giving this device 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Bobbie Smallwood
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to review the recorded video.  Instructions are not easy to understand. aside from that the pictures are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Good video camera
Reviews.Author: Javier Rebolledo
Reviews.Content: This video camera works well for low-cost price, the downside is you have to adapt a SD card over 16 gb to last more than 8 hours recording.

Reviews.Title: Not Quite right
Reviews.Author: Snipe
Reviews.Content: Well the item that I received was not the exact same item listed on the sit, in fact this picture is the best one I can find and even that is not the same one.  http://www.carrocriollo.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/44f26_Car_Video_31UzIFH5PnL.jpgAlso my unit does not have HDMI out, at the highest resolution the video is not perfectly smooth but is good.  I was not really expecting an amazing item for the $25.00 I paid for it but I was expecting to receive the item as shown on the website, I would return it to exchange for another one matching the site but more then likely they are all the same since I ordered 3 and they are all the same.Once I turned it on and was going through the menus (started in Russian) I had a hard time finding how to set the time and date, so I ended up doing a reset and that opened up more options and modes that were not there before.  The resolution settings are in xga, vga and sxga and it took me a bit to figure out that sxga was the highest one, it recorded about 10mins of video and was 500mb, good thing I bought a 32gb card.  Speaking of 32gb card, the website says 32 max, the box says 32 max on one side but on the top is says 64gb, so which is it?Mine as a previous reviewer noted was an avi file that was encoded with mjpeg format as well.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for long..
Reviews.Author: ClassicBob
Reviews.Content: This dashcam is nicely packaged unit, which i was able to velcro in an inconspicous area by the rear view mirror. The mounting hardware didn't have enough adjustments to set it up how i wanted. Worked well for several months but then stopped recording. Finally it stopped powering-up altogether. Unfortunately the return deadline had expired by then, so i'm stuck with this hunk of electronic scrap..

Reviews.Title: Good item works well
Reviews.Author: Stephen C. Handy "The Phone Dude"
Reviews.Content: I got this item and have tested it only but it look sas though it will do the job for me.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: The New Mexican
Reviews.Content: I have not auto tested the unit yet.  The unit is not professional quality, but for $29.00 if it works it will be money well spent.  As for the comment that the instruction manual is worthless, that's true.  It is true that the unit's menu is in another language, but it is easy to get it in English, just play with the menu for afew minutes.  The description on Amazon should indicate that the unit does not come with an SD card, which must be purchased separately.

Reviews.Title: beautiful and compact
Reviews.Author: olivier
Reviews.Content: a nice and compact camera which is easy to start and easy to use . motion detection is really a good idea for that

Reviews.Title: Works fine, hard to read instruction. Very happy with purches
Reviews.Author: curtis stone
Reviews.Content: This camera works well. Happy with results. Glad to have this in my car and thinking of getting another for safety and security. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera...until it stops working
Reviews.Author: Natalia
Reviews.Content: I got it last week and I'm very happy with it so far. At first I was frustrated because the settings on the camera were in Greek, but I was able to figure out and change the language to English. The screen was very dirty and it had a tiny green flap in the corner that I had to pull out with tweezers, and it turned out to be a dirty piece of plastic protecting the new screen. The camera works really well, it's fairly easy to use, no batteries needed, plug into your car's power outlet and it turns on/off as you turn the ignition. You just need to buy an sd card for it and you're good to go!*Updating my review*I rate it 2 stars now instead of 5 because the charger stopped working on its own after a couple of months. I can't use the camera anymore because it only works when it's plugged in to the charger. Bummer!

Reviews.Title: majorpia
Reviews.Author: majorpia
Reviews.Content: wow it has saved me 3 times so far .for crossing the stop line and other bs new york can come up with

Reviews.Title: Bad Product
Reviews.Author: Gorman
Reviews.Content: The camera only worked for about 2 weeks and it started freezing. I tried to reset it and change the memory card but that didn't help. UNRELIABLE!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Roy
Reviews.Content: i bought this dash cam/recorder works great good videos i love itit was here on time i would recomend it for your road trip only thing i did not like is the mount but its a great product.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Cheap Cheap
Reviews.Author: D. Morris "DM"
Reviews.Content: I suppose the saying, "You get what you pay for" applies here. It works, but is very buggy and requires a reset about  once a week. Once you reset the unit through the tiny pin hole, you have to reset the date and all other features. If I had to do it again, I'd just put a little more money into a better camera.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Yinyoungster
Reviews.Content: Pros:Device records in D1 setting which is 848x480 and good to view in PC playback.Records without pause in 2min segments (as opposed to what another reviewer claimed where there was a long pause).Records in an acceptable field of view.Strong suction cup.Cons:Device constantly resets my personalized settings back to factory default after I turn my vehicle on and off.DVR is not HD like what many reviewers have already stated, false advertising.HDMI is non existent, again false advertising.PC Connection is useless, only storage mode works. Why put in PC Cam option if it does not work?@!Playback on the LCD screen is small, therefore if you are looking for fine details in your playback use a PC.Fast fwd and rewind not available during playback.Glare from sun or night recording is below par.Button placement is downright intrusive during operations.Firmware update for this device is badly needed. Anyone know a good website for this?Besides the myriad of cons, you get back you pay for and this device does record and functions as a dvr without additional hitches.

Reviews.Title: cheap and good
Reviews.Author: Joseph Redman
Reviews.Content: Product worth the price....and it works.....but only downfall is.....directions not in english...unless theres a secret way to find it.....Others who bought this , can you explane.....thanks.

Reviews.Title: 100% happy
Reviews.Author: Colin Brent Walton "Colin  Walton"
Reviews.Content: an amazing little camera....easy to use...works well and the price is so cheapThe instructions are pretty cheesy but you can figure it out

Reviews.Title: Experienced Owner
Reviews.Author: Ivan B Free "Ivan"
Reviews.Content: I have bought several of these. Unfortunately the most recent ones come with the language in Chinese. So maybe go to your local restaurant and have them translate it for you. Other than that, it's a great inexpensive unit. I have an older version and the HD is not fully 30fps, but I still suggest it as it gives much better detail. Also, don't use 3 or 5 minute files. Use 15, it takes about 4 seconds for the unit to change from one file to the next. I had mine on 3 minutes, and it missed a collision.Now I've actually used this to establish fault in an accident I was involved in. The other driver claimed I crossed the double yellow line, but the video evidence showed I did no such thing and that *he* drive into me, even though the exact moment of impact was not caught. I gave one to my dad for Christmas who was later side-swiped by a tow truck and the tow-truck driver claimed my dad drifted out of his lane. The video evidence proved otherwise. I also have recorded several drunk drivers. If they had an accident I'd be able to provide that as evidence. This may not be the best unit, but it is the cheapest and I recommend *everyone* get one. Also, cops like to claim "erratic driving" for a reason to pull people over and search their vehicles. This will provide the evidence that the police's claim was false, invaliding the ticket and or arrests.A couple notes: if your car's cigarette lighter is always active, it will record 24/7. It does not drain my battery though. It has a battery in it which will last several minutes at least(I don't know how long), meaning you can take it on the go, and would record parking lot events for several minutes after ou turn the car off as well if your lighter doesn't remain active.A 3-minute file on HD takes 160MB. (2GB flash = 37 minutes, 4GB=1.25h 8GB=2.5h) It'll recycle when it gets full as long as you have a time-limited file (I think the new ones only go up to 15 minutes, older ones could fill the drive then stop recording)It has a microphone which is almost useless.

Reviews.Title: Compare to price, it is WORTHY
Reviews.Author: AKM MOINUL HAQUE
Reviews.Content: If you looking for only vehicle insurance purpose, it is definitely worthy except YOU WILL NOT ABLE TO READ THE LICENSE PLATE due to quality of the video. If you not involve in an hit and run accident, this product will definitely work!!! Considering price, the camera is definitely worthy.

Reviews.Title: great camera .
Reviews.Author: mtnstu
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I not only use it for my car, but I use it to take pictures around the house. Including wild life outside my window. Great pictures, clear view screen.

Reviews.Title: Review of Dash Car Camera
Reviews.Author: djs1lv06
Reviews.Content: This device is very versatile. The audio and video record functions are independent, (you can turn off audio if desired), so friends and coworkers are comfortable conversing in the car with you.

Reviews.Title: For additional insurance in an accident
Reviews.Author: K. Lin "yesuaini99"
Reviews.Content: After watching several traffic accident videos (taped exactly from Car DVR like this one), I decided to buy one and test it out.My friend was involved in a minor fender bender; someone had changed lane without looking and scratched her rear view mirror on my friend's side panel.After they got out of the car to work out the situation, the other car's driver claims it was my friend's fault.He decided to buy a Car DVR due to this incident and I've decided to follow.For $36 and a little work on installation (very easy), you can have peace of mind knowing next time some crazy driver wants to argue fault, you have the evidence to back up everything.One warning, I don't know if the seller specifically says that it doesn't come with any SD card.  So unless you have a spare SD card, it's not ready for use right out of the box.I am ordering another one today for my other car.Check out Youtube for some very detailed reviews on similar items.The video files recorded in the SD can be played back in my Mac very easily without any additional drivers.Once you turn on the engine, it turns on by itself and starts recording.If you have the setting turned on motion sensitive, then after you stop recording, it will start to record again if your car has movement (not too sensitive, but enough if the entire scene is moving.)It has a little fish-eye lens so it records much more than other DVRs that somehow has a "zoomed-in" effect.The unit is light weight, and very easy to use.  The instruction manual is in both English and Chinese.I recommend this to anyone who lives in a heavily populated metro area or anyone like my friend who wants a peace of mind.It's very inexpensive to have this in addition to your car insurance.Apparently the mini HDMI doesn't work but the mini USB does.  So you can bring a lap top to your car if you don't have a SD reader (the device needs to be powered on to transfer the files from SD card.I have it set on recording in 15 min slots.  There will be 2 second blank when closing one file and starting another one.  I have class 6 SD in the device and still has the lag.The instruction is very clear, straight forward and easy to understand.  You don't need to be an engineer to install this thing or getting files out of it.Just buy any 8GB SD card and this unit, you can enjoy the peace mind.The recording file size is quite significant if you set to 1280.  I drove around for less than 10 min and it's already several hundred megabytes.The 12V adapter cable is long enough you can basically install anywhere in your car and still get power.(You can opt to mount it under the moonroof if you want to video part of the inside of the vehicle too. This way, with the fish-eye lens, you can capture pretty much the entire area before the driver seat.)Below is a review for my 2nd unit purchased on Amazon.It's from a different vendor.Even though the retail box appears to be the same with the first unit, the content is slightly different.The main DVR unit is the same however, the mounting kit and the power adapter is different.The mounting kit is better in this unit.  It is smaller.  It comes with a swivel mount like that on a mini tripod.  It can rotate 360 degrees at many different angles.  The screw mount is also a tiny bit deeper (1 1/4 turn to fasten tight, where as the previous unit is only 3/4 turn to fasten, so it comes lose very easily with just a simple turn)Here comes the bad part.  The power adapter cable to the cigarette lighter is too short.  The previous unit provides enough length for you to take it over the sun visor, down the A-pillar (hidden inside the body panels and down under the glove compartment then up to the 12V power.  This one is only about 1/2 as long.  I measured the length, it's under 6" which makes it impossible to hide the cord and thus have to hang directly from the rear view mirror down to the 12V.Also, the way the main unit responds to power on/off is a slightly different.The first unit, once you turn the ignition power off, it also turns off after about 10-15 seconds.This one just remains on for over 1 min, until the internal battery power is drained.The silicon suction cup on this 2nd unit is also inferior in quality.  It has lots of grease on it and it even fell off when I mounted it on the windshield.  So I washed it and wiped it dry and hopefully it will stay secure this time for a while.The recording quality is the same as the first unit.  Again, the HD in a 16x9 format simply means the screen you see is not exactly what is recorded.  You need to point the camera slightly downward to get the most out of the recording.  Otherwise, you would be recording 2/3 the sky and not much the road.Test the unit by driving around a few minutes and then retrieve the SD card and see it in your computer first.  Adjust the angle after viewing the test run so you get the best results.Still recommend this, but I am going to contact the seller to provide a longer cable if possible.3rd updateAfter using it for only 2 days, it shows a dead battery.It's not charing and the motion activation doesn't work.After my car is stopped and engine off, it continues to record for a full 15 min, every single time!!! until the battery dies.And while driving, the screen displays "LOW BATTERY" in huge red letters with a big X across the battery mark on the bottom left corner.It has a faulty battery and a faulty chip board.I am returning this one tomorrow and get a replacement.

Reviews.Content: THIS PRODUCT ITS A NICE PRODUCT TO HAVE, THIS CAN SHOW U WHO IS NEXT TO YOUR CAR AND RECORDE IT. IT WAS A REALLY AFFORDABLE PRICE

Reviews.Title: Windshield mounted Video Recorder-Mount it and forget it.

Reviews.Content: Product lives up to its' billing. Just mount it and forget about it unless you need the video. Previous ratings detailed the poor audio; this is true, but overall it is a great product at a great price. I am not that good at electronic gizmos, but I was still able to find my may through the menus.

Reviews.Title: Great HD camera
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: This is a great HD camera that also has a motion detection feature, a good black box for your car at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but won't keep the Date
Reviews.Author: Patrick Purdy
Reviews.Content: The Picture on this DashCam is Great (mine did have the HDMI Slot), I could clearly read plate numbers, but it wouldn't keep the Date in memory, it would always reset to 01/01/10. It also won't shut down when I turned off my car, it must finish recording the 2, 5 or 15 minute file before it shuts off. If you select 15 minute files it will run out of battery first before it could finish. I sent it back and got a refund.

Reviews.Title: Not great and definitely not as described
Reviews.Author: M.M
Reviews.Content: The first thing I will mention is that people who are having delays with write-overs is due to your SD card. I picked up an SD4/32GB Kingston card. With a card designed for fast operations (digital camera, fast repeat images, etc) you'll see much faster results and no delay. My timestamp from one 15 minute segment ends at 15:39 and the next video picks up at 15:39; and the performance is consistent across all segments.Next is that this product is absolutely NOT HD quality. You cannot read someone's license plate in any mode even if you are kissing their bumper. If someone hits you and drives off then don't bother with trying to track them down with the video; you won't see their plate in the video. The 1280x720 mode only doubles the pixels; so it's best to leave it in 640x480 or 848x480 mode (according to the manual it's 848x480 but the output is actually 720x480).The sound recording is pretty bad and not worth having. It doesn't pick up enough to be usable, but it records enough that it could land you in a lot of legal trouble under Federal law. I'd suggest advising people that you are potentially recording conversations as a function of your in-dash recording (ie, police).The mount seems to be OK. The cord to plug into the cigarette light is pretty long which is nice. Ultimately, this serves my purpose of recording events, ranging from standing in front of it and performing exchanges to recording potential accidents.I'm not looking for anything much better but if you need crisp videos and such then save your money and buy something better. This is definitely not for professionals or anyone who needs to record detailed videos.May 27th, 2012 Update:Frequently when I get in my car I'm finding the camera is turned off and will not turn on. If I leave it unplugged for about 10 minutes and plug it back in then it seems to come back. The only cause I can find is that it's getting warmer outside, but I'm in Seattle and our temperatures aren't even peaking 75f yet. As such, and in light of the previous false advertising regarding the product (being HD, etc), and periods of non-recording while rotating videos-- I've changed my rating to 1 star.

Reviews.Title: It works just fine
Reviews.Author: Chung-yi Chiang "Chiang"
Reviews.Content: The device works fine. It will automatic turn on when the engine starts, but it doesn't automatic turn off when the engine is turned off. Based on the video it saves, I don't think it is HD.

Reviews.Title: Menu on devise not in English
Reviews.Author: Donald A. DeFrance
Reviews.Content: Item arrived in good order but was unable to get the menu from Chinese to English. Also the Manual was less than "no help". Was unable to program devise.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: It is not my first experience in using DBROTH cameras. Video quality - the best. More problems to install and read the video player to your computer, you have to know Chinese language. But after installation you have a very good video player.Built-in rechargeable battery or 12V can record video up to 50 minutes. Use Car Charger and record video till the flash memory will be full. Buy 8GB card and you can record up to 3 hours video. Camera has no loop recording, but you can buy more 8GB memory cards, or buy Transcend 32 GB SDHC Class 6 Flash Memory Card and have almost 12 hours of video. You can buy also the Card Reader, but in the box you have also cord with USB connector. Camera has no night mode, and can not make enough clear video in darkness. Suction cup mounting bracket is working good, but I could not find another one on Amazone.com. In Product Description provided wrong information: Sony 1/4 color CMOS SXGA HD Image Sensor Lens is not 120 degree (wide angle). It is just 90 degree. Seems you have to buy more then one camera. You can easy set Date and Time using on-screen menu. I really like this DVR Camera.

Reviews.Content: the menu is in an Asian language so there is no way to tell which actions I'm taking.  If they had a website or other directions it would be nice.  It is very cheap so I didn't expect much...

Reviews.Content: Broke for no reason a few months after I bought it. Im never buying this product again. Complete junk. Yes it worked AMAZING for a few months but one day it just stopped working completely for no reason other than it must be defective.

Reviews.Author: danni
Reviews.Content: I couldn't use this because there were no english on screen instructions. They were all in a foreign language. Very dissapointing :(

Reviews.Title: AWESOME! Until it broke.
Reviews.Author: Mark "Better to have and not need, than to ne...
Reviews.Content: I had this product for one and a half weeks. It worked like a charm! Suction mount, perfect. Video quality, I never used the HD...didn't need to. The 640 setting was just fine for proving who doesn't know how to drive, if I had an accident. The temperature dipped to -1C (Canada) - and I tried to power it up...nothing. The screen blinked, froze...the unit shut down. Reset after Reset, after Reset...I was hoping to get a year or two atleast. It didn't even last two weeks. I want one after seeing what it could do, but I guess I'm going to have to fork out some bigger dough for a name brand model or something. Sorry folks, I really wanted to write a postive review - I had high hopes for this thing.
